articles.author: Geoff Graham
articles.description:
Hey, so it‚Äôs been a minute since we announced that CSS-Tricks is now part of the DigitalOcean family. Things are pretty much business as usual and hopefully it feels that way to you, too. Now that we‚Äôre getting settled, we‚Äôre ‚Ä¶
Help Shape the Future of CSS-Tricks! originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Help Shape the Future of CSS-Tricks!

articles.author: Geoff Graham
articles.description:
We all make mistakes in our code. It happens! I know if I had one of those ‚ÄúDays Since Last Mistake‚Äù signs hanging over my desk, a big ol‚Äô goose egg would be hovering above me all the time. It ‚Ä¶
My Dumbest CSS Mistakes originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: My Dumbest CSS Mistakes

articles.author: Victor Adedokun
articles.description:
Right after ‚ÄúWhere is the best place to learn?‚Äù perhaps the most commonly asked question I hear from folks getting into code is ‚ÄúWhat web development books should I get to learn?‚Äù Well, consider this an answer to that question ‚Ä¶
Great (and Free!) Web Development Books You Can Get Online originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Great (and Free!) Web Development Books You Can Get Online

articles.author: Temani Afif
articles.description:
We‚Äôve looked at spinners. We‚Äôve looked at dots. Now we‚Äôre going to tackle another common pattern for loaders: bars. And we‚Äôre going to do the same thing in this third article of the series as we have the others ‚Ä¶
Single Element Loaders: The Bars originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Single Element Loaders: The Bars

articles.author: Saleh Mubashar
articles.description:
We‚Äôre all familiar with the standard way of linking up a stylesheet to the <head> of an HTML doc, right? That‚Äôs just one of several ways we‚Äôre able to write CSS. But what does it look like to style things ‚Ä¶
Different Ways to Write CSS in React originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Different Ways to Write CSS in React

articles.author: Temani Afif
articles.description:
We‚Äôre looking at loaders in this series. More than that, we‚Äôre breaking down some common loader patterns and how to re-create them with nothing more than a single div. So far, we‚Äôve picked apart the classic spinning loader. Now, ‚Ä¶
Single Element Loaders: The Dots originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Single Element Loaders: The Dots

articles.author: Preethi
articles.description:
Calendars, shopping carts, galleries, file explorers, and online libraries are some situations where selectable items are shown in grids (i.e. square lattices). You know, even those security checks that ask you to select all images with crosswalks or whatever.
üßê‚Ä¶
Conditionally Styling Selected Elements in a Grid Container originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Conditionally Styling Selected Elements in a Grid Container

articles.author: Geoff Graham
articles.description:
Well, sheesh. I opened a little can of worms when sharing Miriam‚Äôs ‚ÄúAm I on the IndieWeb yet?‚Äù with a short post bemoaning my own trouble getting on the IndieWeb train. But it‚Äôs a good can of worms.
I think ‚Ä¶
De-Mystifying IndieWeb on a WordPress Site originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: De-Mystifying IndieWeb on a WordPress Site

articles.author: Aisha Bukar
articles.description:
A diagram is a graphical representation of information that depicts the structure, relationship, or operation of anything. Diagrams enable your audience to visually grasp hidden information and engage with them in ways that words alone cannot. Depending on the type ‚Ä¶
Useful Tools for Visualizing Databases on a Budget originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Useful Tools for Visualizing Databases on a Budget

articles.author: Temani Afif
articles.description:
Making CSS-only loaders is one of my favorite tasks. It‚Äôs always satisfying to look at those infinite animations. And, of course, there are lots of techniques and approaches to make them ‚Äî no need to look further than CodePen to ‚Ä¶
Single Element Loaders: The Spinner originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Single Element Loaders: The Spinner

articles.author: Geoff Graham
articles.description:
Can‚Äôt smash the Like button hard enough for what Miriam Suzanne has to say on the challenging technical hurdles of implementing Webmentions:
The first round required several online services along with¬†HTML¬†&¬†JS changes to my static site, just to verify my 
‚Ä¶
Am I on the IndieWeb yet? originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Am I on the IndieWeb yet?

articles.author: Geoff Graham
articles.description:
QR codes are funny, right? We love them, then hate them, then love them again. Anyways, they‚Äôve lately been popping up again and it got me thinking about how they‚Äôre made. There are like a gazillion QR code generators out ‚Ä¶
Let‚Äôs Make a QR Code Generator With a Serverless Function! originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Let‚Äôs Make a QR Code Generator With a Serverless Function!

articles.author: Adam Rackis
articles.description:
Those of us who‚Äôve been web developers more than a few years have probably written code using more than one JavaScript framework. With all the choices out there ‚Äî React, Svelte, Vue, Angular, Solid ‚Äî it‚Äôs all but inevitable. One ‚Ä¶
Building Interoperable Web Components That Even Work With React originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Building Interoperable Web Components That Even Work With React

articles.author: Geoff Graham
articles.description:
There‚Äôs all kinds of ways to do that. Some more advisable and better-suited for certain situations than others, of course.
We could do it directly in HTML:
<pWe go from one line...<br<brdown a couple more.</p
But that‚Äôs ‚Ä¶
Please Give Me Some Space originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Please Give Me Some Space

articles.author: Ganesh Dahal
articles.description:
Block patterns, also frequently referred to as sections, were introduced in WordPress 5.5 to allow users to build and share predefined block layouts in the pattern directory. The directory is the home of a wide range of ‚Ä¶
How to Create Block Theme Patterns in WordPress 6.0 originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: How to Create Block Theme Patterns in WordPress 6.0

sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine ‚Äî For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Drew McLellan)
articles.description: In this episode, we ask if Sass is still relevant in 2022 and if it adds any value modern CSS workflows. Vitaly talks to expert Stephanie Eckles to find out.
articles.title: Smashing Podcast Episode 48 With Stephanie Eckles: Is Sass Still Relevant?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Juan Diego Rodr√≠guez)
articles.description: Gatsby 4 came out in October 2021 with a lot of new features. It may seem as if Gatsby 4 didn‚Äôt cause a big stir among developers, but it brought several game-changing features. Let‚Äôs see what v4 brings to the table.
articles.title: Demystifying The New Gatsby Framework

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Eric Bailey)
articles.description: Partially visually hidden link names may be good for people who use screen readers, but they can be problematic for those who rely on voice control software. Here‚Äôs a suggestion on how to solve this.
articles.title: Voice Control Usability Considerations For Partially Visually Hidden Link Names

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Anna Prenzel)
articles.description: In this article, we will enhance the Gantt Chart component with some interaction possibilities for editing the jobs. In doing so, we will continue to work with Vanilla JS and Web Components and look at some JavaScript libraries that can greatly simplify the effort of developing a fully functional Gantt Chart.
articles.title: How To Create A Vanilla JavaScript Gantt Chart: Adding Task Editing Features (Part 2)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Sergey Krasotin)
articles.description: Looking for ways to test your product faster? In this article, Sergey Krasotin uncovers common mistakes startup product designers make that lead to longer MVP testing times. To test your product within two weeks or even less, follow these simple practices proven by Sergey‚Äôs experience with over 100 startups and accelerators.
articles.title: How To Test Your MVP Within 2 Weeks (Or Less)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: Do you feel stuck in your company? Do you believe you deserve a raise but it never happens? Do you think you might need to quit the job? Let‚Äôs figure it out. In this article, Vitaly looks at some things he wishes he‚Äôd known earlier in his career.
articles.title: Things I Wish I‚Äôd Known Earlier In My Career

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Kirill Myshkin)
articles.description: In JavaScript, it‚Äôs natural to reach for timers when something is to happen on time. But when something is to happen at the exact moment because other things depend on it, you quickly learn timers are more of a problem than a solution. They are never on time, really. Web Animations API could eliminate the need for timers in certain cases while being precise.
articles.title: Precise Timing With Web Animations API

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Andrii Zhdan)
articles.description: In this article, Andrii shares his approach to managing tables in Figma in an easier, more streamlined way when there is a need to support different screen resolutions, change the order of columns, and use real-life content.
articles.title: How To Easily Build And Support Tables In Figma

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Frederick O‚ÄôBrien)
articles.description: All the data in the world won‚Äôt do anyone any good if we can‚Äôt make sense of it. Or better yet, make it sing. Here are some stunning examples of data visualization in the wild, and some pointers on how to start making your own.
articles.title: Web Design Done Well: Delightful Data Visualization Examples

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cristian D√≠az)
articles.description: In this article, we‚Äôll see how to make our sites friendly for Windows High Contrast Mode by using a good set of practices, including the media query `forced-colors` and its toolset.
articles.title: The Guide To Windows High Contrast Mode

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Leonardo Losoviz)
articles.description: Do you need search for your site, but haven‚Äôt found the time to add it? Within 15 minutes, Leonardo Losoviz explains how you can add a super powerful search that also looks super good. In this article, you‚Äôll learn how to go from 0 to 100 with search.
articles.title: Adding Search To Your Site In 15 Minutes

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Eva Rio)
articles.description: In this article, Eva gives an overview of what embedded systems are and how they impact our lives. She presents three main learnings gained across her quest for creating better-embedded systems to enable the world as we know it.
articles.title: How To Apply UX Principles To Embedded Systems: Learnings From The Field

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: [DevFest for Ukraine](https://devfest.gdg.org.ua/) is a charitable online conference that will bring together 20 industry-leading tech speakers in support of Ukraine. June 14‚Äì15.
articles.title: DevFest For Ukraine, A Charity Conference On The Future Of Tech üá∫üá¶

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Thomas Bohm)
articles.description: In this article, Thomas Bohm explains ways to test typefaces and other typographic issues. Though this article is slightly high-end and academic, fear not. The content will be interesting, especially for committed typeface designers and typographers. If you like complex issues and problems, this is for you.
articles.title: Measuring The Performance Of Typefaces For Users (Part 2)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Alexander Joseph)
articles.description: This article explores the evolution and the future of frontend tooling, presenting a new set of tools featuring a change in paradigm, platform, or both.
articles.title: The Future Of Frontend Build Tools

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Daniel Yuschick)
articles.description: CSS color-mix is an experimental function that blends two colors and can be used to simplify color palettes. You can define a color palette and theme without too much effort using CSS color-mix().
articles.title: Simplify Your Color Palette With CSS Color-Mix()

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Alexey & Alexander)
articles.description: Computer technologies have simplified the process of recording historical events, technological breakthroughs, contemporary art, and everyday life. However, the notion of digital archiving can be deceptive. Often our technical footprints are carved in sand rather than stone.
articles.title: Digital Museums For Digital History

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Sam Poder)
articles.description: In this article, Sam Poder explores how Prisma integrates with the Jamstack and why it‚Äôs a great solution for Serverless databases in JavaScript or TypeScript-based projects.
articles.title: The Case For Prisma In The Jamstack

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Thomas Bohm)
articles.description: This is the first part of this article, written especially for typeface designers and typographers. See how typefaces work, how to test them, and other broader typographic issues.
articles.title: Measuring The Performance Of Typefaces For Users (Part 1)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Zara Cooper)
articles.description: In this tutorial, you will learn how to create a group chat app. You will build a backend app using Node.js that will make group chats, authorize chat participants, and maintain sessions for them.
articles.title: How To Build A Group Chat App With Vanilla JS, Twilio And Node.js

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ken Harker)
articles.description: In this article, Ken Harker explains what third-party resource requests really are and which common optimization strategies can help reduce the impact on the user experience. By carefully considering how third-party requests will fit into your website during the design stage, you‚Äôll be able to avoid the most significant negative impacts.
articles.title: Don‚Äôt Sink Your Website With Third Parties

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: What could be a better way to welcome June than with some colorful inspiration? Well, we might have something for you: wallpapers created with love by artists and designers from across the globe.
articles.title: Expand Your Horizons (June 2022 Desktop Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Drew McLellan)
articles.description: In this episode of the Smashing Podcast, we ask why accessibility really matters and why it is so important to get it right. Smashing‚Äôs Vitaly Friedman talks in-depth to Sara Soueidan to find out.
articles.title: Smashing Podcast Episode 47 With Sara Soueidan: Why Does Accessibility Matter?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Patrick Brosset)
articles.description: How many browser DevTools panels do you commonly use in your day-to-day web development? One? Three? Probably not that many more. In this article, Patrick Brosset shines the spotlight on a number of tools that people don‚Äôt use or even know about. Let‚Äôs dive in!
articles.title: What‚Äôs That (Dev) Tool?

articles.author: CESS

articles.title: How to Understand Complex Coding Concepts Using the Feynman Technique

articles.author: Sebastian Sigl
articles.description: Java is one of the most popular programming languages in use today. And a clean setup lets you seamlessly install Java and switch between different versions when you're building applications.  In this tutorial you will learn how to:  * Install any Java version,  * Switch between Java
articles.title: How to Install Java in Ubuntu ‚Äì JDK Linux Tutorial

articles.author: Kolade Chris
articles.description: Whether you are a web developer or you are a regular internet user, you might have encountered a 429 error. It means that the website can't handle the number of requests being sent to it. For a developer, this error can be hard to resolve because, on many occasions, it
articles.title: 429 Error ‚Äì Too Many Requests HTTP Code Explained

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: Many tech companies want people to solve coding challenges during interviews and many of the challenges can be solved using a greedy algorithm. A greedy algorithm is any algorithm that follows the problem-solving heuristic of making the locally optimal choice at each stage.  We just published a course on
articles.title: Learn Greedy Algorithms and Solve Coding Challenges

articles.author: Bikash Daga (Jain)
articles.description: The Fibonacci Series is a special kind of sequence that starts with 0 and 1, and every number after those two is the sum of the two preceding numbers.  The Fibonacci series goes like this: 0, 1, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13, 21, ‚Ä¶ and so on. It
articles.title: How to Write a Java Program to Get the Fibonacci Series

articles.author: Joel Olawanle
articles.description: When you're developing applications like a blog or a page where the data may change based on user actions, you'll want that page to refresh frequently. When the page refreshes or reloads, it will show any new data based off those user interactions. Good news ‚Äì you can implement this
articles.title: Refresh the Page in JavaScript ‚Äì JS Reload Window Tutorial

articles.author: Jessica Wilkins
articles.description: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is an important markup language for building websites. HTML represents the content of the web page. But when you are learning this information for the first time, it can be hard to keep track of all of the different HTML elements.  In this article, I

articles.author: Ihechikara Vincent Abba

articles.title: NameError: Name plot_cases_simple is Not Defined ‚Äì How to Fix this Python Error

articles.author: Dillion Megida
articles.description: There are multiple ways to empty an existing array in JavaScript. Emptying an array means removing all values from it. In this article, I'll show and explain two ways to clear an array. 1. How to Clear an Array by Modifying the Length Property The length property of an array
articles.title: How to Clear a JavaScript Array ‚Äì JS Empty Array

articles.author: Ihechikara Vincent Abba

articles.title: Why Static in Java? What does this keyword mean? [Solved]
